Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: U. S. secretary of labor and senator from Pennsylvania. Correspondence, diaries, speeches and writings, investgation files, financial papers, scrapbooks, photographs, and printed matter relating to Davis's service as secretary of labor in three Republican presidential administrations, his tenure as senator from Pennsylvania, and as organizer and leader of the Loyal Order of Moose.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

corpname.part: United States. Congress. Senate. Select Committee on Senatorial Campaign Expenditures.

acqinfo.head: Provenance

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The papers of James J. Davis were arranged and described in 1959. The finding aid was revised in 2012.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of James J. Davis in these papers and in other collections of papers in the custody of the Library of Congress has been dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of James J. Davis are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, James J. Davis Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Born James J. Davies, Tredagar, Wales
Immigrated to the United States with his parents
Apprenticed as a puddler's assistant in iron works, Sharon, Pa.
Moved to Elwood, Ind., and worked as city clerk
Active with the Loyal Order of Moose, serving as supreme organizer and director general
Secretary of labor in the Warren G. Harding, Calvin Coolidge, and Herbert Hoover administrations
Ran unsuccessfully for govenor of Pennsylvania
Administrative assistant to Senator William Langer of North Dakota

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The papers of James J. Davis (1873-1947) span the years 1895-1946, with the bulk of the material concentrated in the period 1931-1946. The collection consists of thirteen series:
Diaries ,
Loyal Order of Moose Correspondence ,
Patronage Correspondence ,
Political Correspondence ,
Family Correspondence ,
Special File ,
Financial File ,
Book File ,
Speeches and Articles ,
Scrapbooks and Personal Miscellany ,
Printed Matter ,
Photographs and Cartoons , and
Oversize .

The
Diaries
include desk diaries and a register of constituents. The three correspondence series and
Special File relate to political matters, constituent services, job seekers, and to his activities as a founder, organizer, and director general of the Loyal Order of Moose. Correspondents include Rhys J. Davies, Homer L. Ferguson, Herbert Hoover, and Andrew W. Mellon.

The
Special File includes files on Davis's senatorial campaign in 1931; the United States Congress Senate Select Committee on Senatorial Campaign Expenditures investigation, headed by Gerald P. Nye, of his campaign expenses; and a legal case where he was the defendant, United States v. Davis, the Loyal Order of Moose lottery trial. The
Speeches and Articles includes Davis's writings and speeches about labor relations, unemployment, social security, various political campaigns, and a draft of his unpublished book, "The History of Strikes."

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in thirteen series:

scopecontent.p: Scheduling desk diaries and a constituents register.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence sent and received while Davis was senator from Pennsylvania with persons seeking employment in government and private industry.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by job seeker or position sought, as organized by Davis.

did.unittitle: United States attorney for Eastern Pennsylvania
United States Circuit Court of Appeals, James J. Wilkerson
United States Circuit Court of Appeals, Ninth District
United States District Court, Easten Pennsylvania
United States District Court, Eastern Pennsylvania, Warren C. Graham
United States Veterans' Bureau, Pittsburgh, Pa.
Virgin Islands governorship, Paul M. Pearson

scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received relating to politics and political campaigns.

arrangement.p: Arranged by name of correspondent or subject within chronological periods.

scopecontent.p: Letters between Davis and his son, James J. Davis, Jr.
Legal papers, voting records, clippings, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: United States Congress Senate Select Committee on Senatorial Campaign Expenditures investigation headed by Gerald P. Nye, 1931
United States v. Davis, Loyal Order of Moose lottery trial, 1932
Bethlehem Steel and Youngstown Sheet and Tube Co., merger, 1930

Guam naval base, debate and vote,
1940
Income tax, insurance policies, stocks, and bonds
Notes, leases, campaign expense statememnts, expense accounts, and Loyal Order of Moose financial records

scopecontent.p: Draft of Davis's unpublished book, "History of Strikes," with related correspondence.
Speeches and articles in typscript, printed, or draft format.
Scrapbooks, a copy of Davis's death certificate, certificates of appreciation, a gavel, and miscellaneous material.

arrangement.p: Material chronologically arranged within scrapbooks. Personal miscellany unarranged.

did.unittitle:
Photographs and political cartoons, 1895-1946
See also Oversize

arrangement.p: Arranged according to the series and files from which the material was removed.
